com.locuslabs.sdk.ibeacon

Class IBeaconManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.locuslabs.sdk.ibeacon.IBeaconManager

  • public class IBeaconManager
extends java.lang.Object
    An class used to set up interaction with iBeacons from an Activity or Service. This class is used in conjunction with IBeaconConsumer interface, which provides a callback when the IBeaconService is ready to use. Until this callback is made, ranging and monitoring of iBeacons is not possible. In the example below, an Activity implements the IBeaconConsumer interface, binds to the service, then when it gets the callback saying the service is ready, it starts ranging. 
    
  public class BeaconsActivity extends Activity implements IBeaconConsumer {
        protected static final String TAG = "BeaconsActivity";
        private IBeaconManager iBeaconManager = IBeaconManager.getInstanceForApplication(this);
          @Override
        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
                setContentView(R.layout.activity_ranging);
                iBeaconManager.bind(this);
        }
          @Override 
        protected void onDestroy() {
                super.onDestroy();
                iBeaconManager.unBind(this);
        }
          @Override
        public void onIBeaconServiceConnect() {
                iBeaconManager.setRangeNotifier(new RangeNotifier() {
                  @Override 
                public void didRangeBeaconsInRegion(Collection iBeacons, Region region) {
                        if (iBeacons.size() > 0) {
                                Log.i(TAG, "The first iBeacon I see is about "+iBeacons.iterator().next().getAccuracy()+" meters away.");               
                        }
                }
                });
                
                try {
                        iBeaconManager.startRangingBeaconsInRegion(new Region("myRangingUniqueId", null, null, null));
                } catch (RemoteException e) {   }
        }
  }

      • getInstanceForApplication

        public static IBeaconManager getInstanceForApplication(android.content.Context context)
        An accessor for the singleton instance of this class. A applicationContext must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

      • bind

        public void bind(IBeaconConsumer consumer)
        Binds an Android Activity or Service to the IBeaconService. The Activity or Service must implement the IBeaconConsuemr interface so that it can get a callback when the service is ready to use.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Activity or Service that will receive the callback when the service is ready.

      • unBind

        public void unBind(IBeaconConsumer consumer)
        Unbinds an Android Activity or Service to the IBeaconService. This should typically be called in the onDestroy() method.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Activity or Service that no longer needs to use the service.

      • startRangingBeaconsInRegion

        public void startRangingBeaconsInRegion(Region region)
                                 throws android.os.RemoteException,
                                        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Tells the IBeaconService to start looking for iBeacons that match the passed Region object, and providing updates on the estimated distance very seconds while iBeacons in the Region are visible. Note that the Region's unique identifier must be retained to later call the stopRangingBeaconsInRegion method.
        Parameters:
        region -
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        See Also:
        setRangeNotifier(RangeNotifier), stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(Region region), RangeNotifier, Region

                                   throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the IBeaconService to stop looking for iBeacons that match the passed Region object. Note that the Region's unique identifier is used to match it to and existing monitored Region.
